description: Borrowed from Hindi सरपंच (sarpañc), from Hindi सर (sar, “head”) / Urdu سر‎ (sar, “head; chief”) (from Persian سر‎ (sar, “head; chief, leader”), ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *ḱerh₂- (“head; top”)) + Hindi पंच (pañc, “five (number of people in a panchayat council)”) / Urdu پنچ‎ (pañc); from Sanskrit पञ्चन् (pañcan, “five”), ultimately from Proto-Indo-European *pénkʷe (“five”).

entries.meaning: The elected head of a panchayat (village government) in Bangladesh, India, or Pakistan.
